meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy back with another groovy review of Octopath Traveler II. I mean, who doesn't love a good JRPG? But before we dive in, let me just say that I'm not the biggest fan of myself... I mean, have you seen my review scores? *ahem* Moving on!

So, what's the verdict from the big-name critics? Well, GameSpot gives it an 80, saying it's an ideal sequel that improves upon the original. Game Informer agrees, with an 85, stating that it does what a great sequel should – improve on the first one in nearly every way. Vandal also chimes in with an 85, saying it delivers one of the best JRPGs of recent years.

Now, Nintendo Life and Game Revolution both give it a 90, praising its triumphant follow-up, gorgeous visuals, and incredible soundtrack. And finally, SpazioGames gives it an 88, calling it a first-rate JRPG with superior qualities compared to the original.

But what do I think? Well, I'll keep that under my hat for now... just kidding! Let's get to the good stuff!

Octopath Traveler II is like the ultimate JRPG mashup. It takes the best bits from various Square Enix franchises – think Final Fantasy, Chrono Trigger, and maybe even a dash of Xenogears (okay, I might be stretching that one a bit). But seriously, it's a love letter to old-school RPGs with modern twists.

The combat system is where it shines. It's like a delicious mix of turn-based battles and real-time action. You'll have to strategize and adjust on the fly to take down those pesky baddies. And don't even get me started on the character progression! You can shape your heroes into whatever you want – tank, healer, DPS, or something in between.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, this all sounds like a lot of fun... but is it too much of the same?" Well, let me put it this way. If you loved the original Octopath Traveler, you'll love this one just as much (if not more). The improvements are noticeable, and the new ideas keep things fresh. And if you're new to the series? You've got a fantastic starting point.

In conclusion, Hippo Penny says... Octopath Traveler II is an absolute must-play for any JRPG fan. It's a testament to Team Asano's mastery of their craft, with gorgeous visuals, an incredible soundtrack, and engaging combat. So, what are you waiting for? Join the journey and experience this amazing RPG for yourself!

(Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to go calculate my review score... wink-wink.)
